info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near El Porvenir, or 8 miles west of Las Vegas, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Montezuma, El Porvenir, Storrie Lake State Park, San Geronimo, Mineral Hill, San Pablo and Gallinas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 342 and 349. State Road 104 near Mile Marker 1. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12, and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
